DOC.detailed_description: The study objective test whether 2-day high dose atorvastatin administration PCI 30-day continuous intensive atorvastatin treatment superior usual care , term peri-PCI cardiovascular event , well 6-month prognosis . 2160 patient non-ST segment elevate acute coronary syndrome ( ACS ) stable angina pectoris ( SAP ) schedule selective PCI randomize two group . The study group give atorvastatin 80 mg/d×2d PCI control group receive usual care . After angiography , patient undergo PCI procedure exclude study selection failure . After PCI procedure , study group give atorvastatin 40mg/d 30 day PCI control group receive usual care . The last visit 6 month PCI . Patients data troponin , CK-MB , Scr , CCR , ALT , AST procedure record . 1100 effective patient finally enrol . The study conduct 54 center China . Data collect 2,100 NSTE SAP patient undergo PCI . Primary outcome : MACE within 30 day PCI . Secondary outcome : Post-procedural change inflammatory biomarkers ( hs-CRP ) ; Morbidity CIN ; Proportion patient experience least AST > 3ULN，ALT > 3ULN CK > 5ULN initiation study treatment . Proportion patient experience least AST , ALT , CK > ULN initiation study treatment ; Proportion patient take reduce dose atorvastatin , withdraw study treatment , withdraw study due adverse event ; Combined endpoint death , cardiac death , myocardial infarction , heart failure , cardiac hospitalization , revascularization , cerebrovascular event within 6 month PCI .
